bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wenceslao Pareja, December 28, 1922

div1.p: Carter inquires about Weil's Disease (Leptospirosis ictero-hemorrhagica) in Guayaquil, Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Wenceslao Pareja, December 28, 1922
div1.opener:
I. H. B
Guayaquil
/LC
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
December 28, 1922.
Dr. Wenceslao Pareja,
Jefe de Sanidad,
Guayaquil,
Ecuador, S. A.
Dear Doctor Pareja:
div1.p:
I am being told that there are a certain number of cases of
Weil's Disease (Leptospirosis ictero-hemorrhagica) occurring among
men at Guayaquil. This seems to have excited some alarm lest it
be yellow fever diagnosticated as such, as no Weil's Disease
had been reported there prior to 1918.

Do you remember, at the Atlantic City meeting, I said that
as Noguchi had found a large proportion--my recollection is 67%--
of the rats in Guayaquil infected with the ictero-hemorrhagica
and that the amount of Bubonic plague in men in that city show-
ed a fairly close contaminative relation between rats and men,
that it would not be reasonable but that cases of this disease had
occurred among men also--that it was, indeed, inconceivable but
that such cases had occurred and since none had been reported as
such--this was based on your own statement--they must have been
mistaken for, and reported as, yellow fever--a thing which any-
one would have done where yellow fever was prevalent, unless
unless
2.
their attention was especially called to the possibility of this
mistake, and that therefore it was incumbent upon Noguchi to dif-
ferentiate his Leptospira icteroides absolutely from the Ictero-
hemorrhagica before we could be positive that he had not obtained
them from men suffering from the latter disease.

What of it? What can you tell me of the occurrence of this
Ictero-hemorrhagica among men now, and in time past, in Guayaquil?
I shall be very grateful to you for any information on the subject.

I am enclosing the photograph you asked me for, which I will
be very proud to have hanging in the office of my friend.
With all manner of good wishes for the New Year.
div1.closer:
Very truly your friend, Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
